interp

Class Stack

  • java.lang.Object
    • interp.Stack

  • public class Stack
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent the memory of the virtual machine of the interpreter. The memory is organized as a stack of activation records and each entry in the activation record contains is a pair .

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  Stack.StackTraceItem
      Class to represent an item of the Stack trace.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Data> CurrentAR
      Reference to the current activation record
      private java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Data>> Stack
      Stack of activation records
      private java.util.LinkedList<Stack.StackTraceItem> StackTrace
      Stack trace to keep track of function calls

      • pushActivationRecord

                        int line)
        Creates a new activation record on the top of the stack

      • popActivationRecord

        public void popActivationRecord()
        Destroys the current activation record

      • defineVariable

        public void defineVariable(java.lang.String name,
                  Data value)
        Defines the value of a variable. If the variable does not exist, it is created. If it exists, the value and type of the variable are re-defined.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable
        value - The value of the variable

      • getArrayVar

        public Data getArrayVar(java.lang.String name,
               int idx)

      • getVariable

        public Data getVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the value of the variable. The value is represented as a Data object. In this way, any modification of the object implicitly modifies the value of the variable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable
        Returns:
        The value of the variable

      • getStackTrace

        public java.lang.String getStackTrace(int current_line)
        Generates a string with the contents of the stack trace. Each line contains a function name and the line number where the next function is called. Finally, the line number in the current function is written.
        Parameters:
        current_line - program line executed when this function is called.
        Returns:
        A string with the contents of the stack trace.

      • getStackTrace

        public java.lang.String getStackTrace(int current_line,
                             int nitems)
        Generates a string with a summarized contents of the stack trace. Only the first and last items of the stack trace are returned.
        Parameters:
        current_line - program line executed when this function is called.
        nitems - number of function calls returned in the string at the beginning and at the end of the stack.
        Returns:
        A string with the contents of the stack trace.
